intro: Daphnopsis schwackeana var. itatiaiensis, commonly known as the Itatiaia daphnopsis, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within the Atlantic Forest biome. It features small, dark green leaves and produces clusters of pink or white flowers during the spring and summer seasons. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
